sources.title: Interference
sources.description: Title: Interference Summary: Paramount's 1st ALL TALKIE Reported killed in action, Philip Voaze(William Powell) lives under an assumed name in London. Deborah Kane(Evelyn Brent) a former love, discovers him and tries ... Directed by: Lothar Mendes, Roy Pomeroy Actors: Production Company: Paramount Pictures Release Date: 1929 (Austria) Aspect Ratio: 1.20 : 1 Paramount's 1st ALL TALKIE Reported killed in action, Philip Voaze(William Powell) lives under an assumed name in London. Deborah Kane(Evelyn Brent) a former love, discovers him and tries to blackmail his wife, Faith(Doris Kenyon), who has since remarried. Learning of this attempt and that he has a fatal heart disease, he kills Deborah and turns himself in to the police.

sources.title: Interference (1928)
sources.description: I've been researching newly public domain films from 1929 and earlier, so I'm uploading the best possible copies that I can find. Paramount Pictures first fully voiced film, Interference was originally made as a silent picture before being completely remade with sound. Interference was successful enough to be remade in 1935, but reviews were mixed on release.Â

metadata.Plot: Paramount's 1st ALL TALKIE Reported killed in action, Philip Voaze(William Powell) lives under an assumed name in London. Deborah Kane(Evelyn Brent) a former love, discovers him and tries to blackmail his wife, Faith(Doris Kenyon), who has since remarried. Learning of this attempt and that he has a fatal heart disease, he kills Deborah and turns himself in to the police.
metadata.Writer: Harold Dearden, Julian Johnson, Louise Long
metadata.Actors: Evelyn Brent, Clive Brook, William Powell
